description: Adds cross-account permissions to a signing profile.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the signing profile.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: For cross-account signing. Grant a designated account permission to perform one or more of the following actions. Each action is associated with a specific API's operations. For more information about cross-account signing, see Using cross-account signing with signing profiles in the AWS Signer Developer Guide. You can designate the following actions to an account. signer:StartSigningJob. This action isn't supported for container image workflows. For details, see  StartSigningJob. signer:SignPayload. This action isn't supported for AWS Lambda workflows. For details, see  SignPayload signer:GetSigningProfile. For details, see  GetSigningProfile. signer:RevokeSignature. For details, see  RevokeSignature.

parameters.name: principal
parameters.description: The AWS principal receiving cross-account permissions. This may be an IAM role or another AWS account ID.

parameters.name: statementId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the cross-account permission statement.

nested_items.name: revisionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the current profile revision.
